citeinfo.title: Final Critical Habitat for Sierra Nevada yellow-legged frog (Rana sierrae)

descript.abstract: These data identify, in general, the areas of final critical habitat for Sierra Nevada yellow-legged frog (Rana sierrae).
descript.purpose: Critical habitat constitutes areas considered essential for the conservation of a listed species. These areas provide notice to the public and land managers of the importance of the areas to the conservation of this species. Special protections and/or restrictions are possible in areas where Federal funding, permits, licenses, authorizations, or actions occur or are required.

idinfo.useconst: The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics (e.g., GIF or JPG format files) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The information contained in these data may be dynamic and could change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data. The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data be directly acquired from an authorized U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service source and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on computer systems at the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service or through cooperators/contractors, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on other systems for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. The data are not to be used for legal survey use. Please refer to Federal Register Citation Number 81 FR 59046, published 20160826 for the legal critical habitat information.

procstep.procdesc: The features in this shapefile represent final critical habitat subunits for the Sierra Nevada yellow-legged frog. These polygon features were digitized based on boundary delineations drawn on paper maps by the project's lead biologist. Reference data layers on the paper maps included California watershed boundaries, (Watershed Boundary Dataset (WBD)), streams with arrows displaying flow direction, (National Hydrography Dataset (NHD), MaxEnt model habitat quality criteria (Derived by Roland Knapp), a hillshade surface derived from a 30-by 30 meter California digital elevation model(DEM), a polygon displaying a 3 Kilometer extant population buffer (a 3 Kilometer buffer created around extant populations of the Sierra Nevada yellow-legged frog), a polygon displaying a 1000 meter distance aggregation of the MaxEnt model habitat quality criteria polygons (a 1000 meter distance aggregaton polygon created by the Aggregate Polygons tool), and lastly NGS topographic data. Heads-up digitizing of the paper map delineations was performed using these reference layers as guidelines to trace the boundaries of final critical habitat subunits. The final critical habitat subunits were digitized at a scale of 1:24,000 using a UTM Zone 10, NAD 83 Coordinate System. For more detailed information on the lead biologist's criteria for delineating the final critical habitat subunits, please refer to the "Final Critical Habitat Designation" document, under the section "Criteria used to Identify Critical Habitat".
